It is characterized by its distinctive powdery, waxy coating on its leaves and petals, which gives it a soft, almost ethereal appearance. The plant produces delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, often appearing in clusters. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests or rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Declieuxia pulverulenta is considered a vulnerable species.
